IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Provides comprehensive mental health & substance abuse services to children, adults & families.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Counseling Services, Inc. (CSI) is a comprehensive, integrated community mental health agency serving children, adolescents, adults and families suffering with serious mental health and substance abuse problems. CSI provides a broad spectrum of multiple-level, high-quality and affordable mental health and substance abuse treatment and support services for thousands of Maine residents of all ages. Founded in 1963 by York County residents, today's CSI provides outpatient services at its clinics in Biddeford, Kittery, Sanford/Springvale and Westbrook, as well as in homes, schools and other locations. CSI also provides York County's only 24/7 mental health crisis response service.
IRS990.Description: Communty Support Services - These services are provided for individuals who have been diagnosed with a major mental illness and who have significant functional impairment in the community. One goal for individuals receiving these services is to live as independently as possible in the community and to improve their quality of life. CSI provides three levels of care in the community support program: community integration, assertive community treatment and community rehabilitation services. All of the services are community based. Assertive community treatment is a multi-disciplinary team approach which includes nursing, psychiatry, substance abuse services, vocational services, therapy and case management services. Community integration services include supportive counseling and case management services. Community rehabilitation services are offered in two locations, North Berwick and Biddeford. At these sites individuals live in independent apartments which are supervised 12 hours a day and have staff on call 24/7. Providing these levels of care along with a clinical team approach allows for an easy transition down or up from one level of care to another without the disruption, duplication, and cost of changing providers. These services provide a safety net of care, often avoiding hospitalization. Additionally, CSI operates two social clubs in the Sanford/Springvale and Biddeford communities along with life enrichment and peer services. There were 1,390 clients served with 68,841 hours and 4,552 days of service provided.

Activity2.Description: Crisis Services - CSI operates a comprehensive, 24-hour, 7-day a week (365 days a year) crisis intervention program for York County residents. A single toll-free number connects callers to professional crisis response counselors who can offer vital support, information, evaluation, referral and mobile intervention services for children, adolescents and adults. This service often refers callers to CSI or other agencies for outpatient, case management and psychiatric services. In addition, CSI operates 24-hour crisis stabilization beds in Saco which provide an alternative to hospitalization. There were 2,400 clients served with 14,588 hours and 1,732 crisis bed days of service provided.

Activity3.Description: Children's Services - A child-centered and family-focused program. CSI works in concert with schools and other community systems to empower the family, maintain the safety of the child and provide a nurturing environment. Children's services include outpatient mental health and substance abuse services, home-based assertive community treatment services, case management services and home and community treatment services. Home-based assertive community treatment is a multi-disciplinary team approach which includes nursing, psychiatry, therapy and case management services focused on the individual and natural supports. Providing these levels of care along with a clinical team approach allows for an easy transition down or up from one level of care to another without the disruption, duplication, and cost of changing providers. These services provide a safety net of care often avoiding hospitalization. There were 1,554 clients served and 44,904 hours of service provided.

ActivityOther.Description: Residential Services - CSI operates independent and supervised housing. Group homes are located in York and Biddeford and transitional residential housing facilities are operated in Biddeford and Sanford. There were 43 clients served and 8,975 days of service provided.

Adult Outpatient Services - CSI's adult outpatient therapy services are designed to recognize clients' strengths, opportunities for growth and to focus on their diversity by offering client focused treatment plans while providing outpatient psychotherapy services. The goal is to improve their quality of life and help them develop to their fullest potential. CSI offers a variety of complementary therapies including massage, Reiki and acupuncture as an adjunct to traditional mental health and substance abuse services. There were 2,682 clients served and 21,386 hours of service provided.

Psychiatric Services - An integral part of CSI's comprehensive services includes the agency's psychiatric program. Psychiatrists work in partnership with the client, their family/support system, clinician and treatment team. CSI psychiatrists provide psychiatric evaluation and medication management and also provide consultation to primary care providers. CSI employs a team of 15-20 psychiatrists who are licensed to work with children, adolescents and adults. There were 3,539 clients served and 9,645 hours of service provided.

Substance Abuse Services - CSI provides substance abuse services for children, adolescents, adults and affected others including evaluations, individual counseling, group counseling, driver education and drug court. All services are tailored to meet the needs identified in the evaluation. There were 631 clients served and 6,394 hours of service provided.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: One staff member was paid for working on a grass roots effort to involve employees in soliciting legislators and in organizing a rally to protest budget cuts. The organization paid membership dues to a collaborative group that has a contract to monitor legislative activity and to lobby on behalf of the organization's exempt purpose of community mental health services.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: CSI acts as a representative payee to manage funds for 80 - 100 clients. CSI does not own the funds but is responsible for the security of the funds. CSI employees responsible for managing the funds are covered under a commercial crime bond that insures the funds against theft or misuse.
Special event expenses netted against revenue on Form 990: -7342.
Special event expenses netted against revenue on Form 990: -7342.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Sherry Sabo, Former Chief Executive Officer, was paid $123,830 in severance payments during the calendar year 2009 based upon her employment agreement and also was paid $1,088 from a nonqualified retirement plan.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A draft of the completed Form 990 is reviewed by the controller and the COO and presented to the CEO for approval. The draft is then presented to the Board's Human Resources and Finance Committee. The committee reviews the draft and makes recommendations before submitting to the Board for approval. The final draft of the Form 990 is then presented to the full board for approval preceded by an educational review of the 990 form, its sources, audience and intent. The board votes to accept the final draft and the document is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization has adopted and communicated to employees and board members, donors, volunteers, and vendors a specific policy on conflict of interest that specifies that personnel in a position of trust are not related to each other; employees are prohibited from having business dealings with companies affiliated with, or who act as major customers or suppliers of, the organization; transactions with officials of the organization are adequately controlled and disclosed in the records; and such transactions occur only in the normal course of business and are approved by the governing board.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: There are formal policies and procedures to evaluate employee performance and compensation. Management establishes human resource policies and procedures that demonstrate its commitment to integrity, ethical behavior, and competence. Human resource policies and procedures are clearly communicated to employees and issued, updated, and revised on a timely basis. Employee recruitment and retention practices for key financial positions are guided by principles of integrity and by the necessary competencies associated with the positions. There are formal procedures for the hiring (recruiting) and retention of employees. There are screening procedures for job applicants, particularly for employees in managerial positions or positions with access to assets susceptible to misappropriation. Compensation for top management is developed by position using local, state-wide and national surveys results, comparing total compensation practices. Compensation for the CEO is also compiled using market data and is reviewed and administered by the Board of Directors through its Executive Committee.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Requests for governing documents, conflicts of interest policy and financial statements are handled individually through the CEO and Community Relations Offices.
The organization did not change either its oversight process or selection process of its independent accountant during the tax year.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Owns and operates an 8-unit housing facility in North Berwick, ME
